text: hey guys I'm Lindsey strand and today on
sweet talk I'm taking ice cream cake to
the next level I'm making a fairies and
cherries cake that's filled with layers
of chocolate crumb fresh berries and
cherry ice cream this one's a guaranteed
showstopper at your summer party so I'm
starting with the berries and cherries
of course here I have two and a half
cups of mixed berries it's about 1 cup
of pitted cherries and 1 and 1/2 cups of
berries I have here blueberries
blackberries raspberries but really you
could do any combination of berries that
you like to that I'm adding 1/3 of a cup
of granulated sugar and 6 ounces or 3/4
cup of vodka macerating them in this
mixture helps prevent them from freezing
too much and getting really hard in the
freezer so that instead of getting
really icy you maintain that great berry
texture you don't have to use vodka if
you don't want to if you're worried
about it staying in the berries but we
are gonna strain it out after a couple
of hours so there's really not that much
left in here but you could macerate them
just in sugar so now that those are
gonna sit for a little bit let those go
for two hours or refrigerate them for up
to 12 now I'm ready to work on my
chocolate cookie crust so here I have 9
ounces of chocolate cookie wafers and
put them into a food processor and pulse
them with 4 tablespoons of melted butter
and half a teaspoon of kosher salt this
is a few pulses until the crumbs are the
texture of wet sand
all right that sounds like it's pretty
combined and I'm going to press half of
this mixture into the bottom of the pan
it's probably about good and I'll save
the rest of these for a center layer and
I'm just gonna use a measuring cup to
tamp this into a 9-inch springform pan I
like to smooth it out across the bottom
and then tamp it down to make sure it's
really solid in the bottom there if you
wanted to you could do this with graham
crackers I think the chocolate looks
really beautiful but you could
definitely use any other sweet cookie
great that looks good
so I'm gonna pop this into the freezer
for 30 minutes until it's firm so I'm
making the first of my two layers this
is the cherry ice cream filling and to
do that I'm adding 1/3 of a cup of
granulated sugar to one and a half cups
of heavy whipping cream on medium-high
until it forms soft peaks
so now I'm adding 2/3 of the whipped
cream mixture to a pint of cherry ice
cream so I'm just gonna eyeball this and
then the rest I will put into the
refrigerator to keep cold until I make
the second layer one more scoop here
it's about like 2/3 give this a quick
fold I tempered the cherry ice cream so
is the consistency of soft serve it's
pretty warm in here today so it might be
a little bit loose but it'll be okay
because we're just gonna put it back in
the freezer right so this just lightens
the ice cream a little bit to make it a
nice texture for the cake now I'm
pouring this layer straight into the pan
this is going into the freezer until
it's firm which takes about an hour all
right so this is nice and frozen as you
can see and I'm going to sprinkle the
rest of my crumbs over the top and pack
it in here forming a nice even layer
this is going back into the freezer
until it's nice and solid at least
another half an hour so now I'm ready to
assemble my second layer this is the
vanilla layer with the fresh berries
folded in so I have a pint of vanilla
ice cream here and I am folding in the
remainder of my whipped cream to the
vanilla ice cream again this is just
lightening the texture a little bit okay
I've drained my soaked berries and I'm
adding half of them in to the ice cream
you can keep that berry vodka for other
uses could be great thrown into a summer
cocktail all right just like that and
I'm going to pour this on top of my
other frozen layer
make sure the berries are evenly
distributed around here now I'm going to
scatter the rest of the berries on top
that's the layer and these will just
poke out a little bit from the surface
and this is going back into the freezer
for at least four hours and up to two
days final step and I know it may seem
like a lot but really if you have a
little bit of time these steps are so
easy this is five ounces of melted
semi-sweet chocolate I'm just gonna
drizzle this all over the top of the
cake this gives it a nice shiny finish
it's an offset to spread it around
I would work quickly here because the
chocolate does Harden when you pour it
on spread it out to the edges all right
I'm going to return this to the freezer
for just a few more minutes until the
chocolate is completely hard alright
guys this is the moment we've all been
waiting for
it's a big reveal of our cherries and
berries extravaganza so I'm just gonna
unmold the ring mold wiggle it straight
up and hopefully tada there she is and
she's looking good so now I'm gonna dip
my knife in some warm water to help with
the cutting score this and if you're
worried about the chocolate cracking
like this I probably just cut into it a
little bit too early so let it temper in
the refrigerator for about ten minutes
and you'll get nice clean slices but of
course I'm always a little impatient
when it comes to getting into my
desserts so there you have it you can
see the pretty berries on the side your
layers of ice cream looks so good I
think this would be a great treat for

takes a little bit of time but it is
